analyzed: sems can gyi phung po mtha' dag bde mchog gi sku thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of all beings attaining the body of Śrī Heruka,

original: bdag dpal bde mchog go //
analyzed: bdag dpal bde mchog go //
translated: I am Śrī Heruka.

original: zhes skad cig la stong pa nyid kyis tha mal pa'i nga rgyal spangs par gyur la /
analyzed: zhes skad cig la stong pa nyid kyis tha mal pa'i nga rgyal spangs par gyur la /
translated: Thus, in an instant, emptiness eliminates ordinary pride.

original: bde mchog phyag gnyis pa shes rab dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i @375a * //
analyzed: bde mchog phyag gnyis pa shes rab dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i @375a * //
translated: The mantra for the yoga of the two-armed Cakrasaṃvara with wisdom consort is oṃ āḥ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: sngags la / aom aa yig la sogs pa ksha yig gi mthar h'um h'um phat ces bya ba lan gsum brjod cing yi ge'i phreng ba g-yon skor gyis gnas pa 'od zer lnga 'phro ba'i lha'i tshogs bgegs kyi tshogs 'joms par bsgoms nas gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams
analyzed: sngags la / aom aa yig la sogs pa ksha yig gi mthar h'um h'um phat ces bya ba lan gsum brjod cing yi ge'i phreng ba g-yon skor gyis gnas pa 'od zer lnga 'phro ba'i lha'i tshogs bgegs kyi tshogs 'joms par bsgoms nas gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams
translated: Recite this three times. Imagine that the garland of letters circling counterclockwise emanates five-colored light rays that destroy the hosts of obstructors.

original: kyi rnam par dag pa rnams par snang mdzad la sogs pa lhag par mos te /
analyzed: kyi rnam par dag pa rnams par snang mdzad la sogs pa lhag par mos te /
translated: Then, with the conviction that the purities of the aggregate of form and so on are Vairocana and so on, recite the four mantras:

original: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um h'um phat /🔽aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom sumbha ni sumbha h'um h'um phat / aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat /
translated: oṃ sumbha niḥ sumbha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ🔽oṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom grihna'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom grihna'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: oṃ gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga p'a na bidy'a r'a dza h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho bha ga p'a na bidy'a r'a dza h'um h'um phat /
translated: oṃ ānayaho bhagavān vidyā rāja hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

original: sngags bzhi rjes su brjod cing /
analyzed: sngags bzhi rjes su brjod cing /
translated: Recite the four mantras.

original: nag po dang ljang gu dang dmar po dang ser po dang tshangs pa'i sgo nga dang / sa 'og gi bar du khyab par 'bar ba'i sku chen po rnams shar dang byang dang nub dang lho'o phyogs rnams su rim pas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: nag po dang ljang gu dang dmar po dang ser po dang tshangs pa'i sgo nga dang / sa 'og gi bar du khyab par 'bar ba'i sku chen po rnams shar dang byang dang nub dang lho'o phyogs rnams su rim pas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The great bodies blazing with black, green, red, yellow, and the color of Brahma's egg, and pervading the underworld, are to be placed in the east, north, west, and south, respectively.

original: de'i 'od zer rnams kyi nge'i kha dog gi ra ba bzhi po rnam sa dang / de dang dus mnyam pa kho nar h'um las skyes shing des byin gyis brlabs pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa bzhi sa 'og gi mthar thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i 'od zer rnams kyi nge'i kha dog gi ra ba bzhi po rnam sa dang / de dang dus mnyam pa kho nar h'um las skyes shing des byin gyis brlabs pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa bzhi sa 'og gi mthar thug pa rnams so //
translated: The four-colored enclosures of their light rays are the four continents, and at the same time as that, the four worlds, which are the nature of a variegated vajra, arisen from hūṃ and blessed by it, extending to the end of the underworld.

original: rdo rje de'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i ra ba dang steng du mda'i dra ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje de'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i ra ba dang steng du mda'i dra ba'o //
translated: The light rays of that vajra are the enclosure of five-pronged vajras and the net of arrows above.

original: de'i 'og tu rdo rje'i gur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rdo rje'i gur ro //
translated: Below that is the vajra tent.

original: de'i 'og tu rdo rje'i bla re yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rdo rje'i bla re yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: Below that, one should imagine the vajra canopy.

original: de nas sumbha la sogs pa'i sngags bzhi po brjod cing phyogs rnams su se gol brdabs pas gdug pa bdun rnams bskrad de /
analyzed: de nas sumbha la sogs pa'i sngags bzhi po brjod cing phyogs rnams su se gol brdabs pas gdug pa bdun rnams bskrad de /
translated: Then, reciting the four mantras beginning with sumbha ni, one snaps one's fingers in the four directions, and the seven types of obstructors are expelled.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba bgegs dang bral bar lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'gro ba bgegs dang bral bar lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that all beings are completely free from obstructors.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar aom las skyes pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um yig sngon po blta zhing de las 'phros pa'i phyogs bcu khyab par yongs su 'phro ba'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis mdun gyi nam mkhar yang dag par bkug ste /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar aom las skyes pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um yig sngon po blta zhing de las 'phros pa'i phyogs bcu khyab par yongs su 'phro ba'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis mdun gyi nam mkhar yang dag par bkug ste /
translated: Then, looking at the blue syllable hūṃ arisen from the syllable oṃ in one's heart, which is located on a moon, one imagines that the hooks of light rays that radiate from it and completely pervade the ten directions summon the deities into the space in front.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la /
translated: Then, one should offer them to the maṇḍala wheel that will be explained.

original: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'thon pa'i me tog ma dang / bdug pa ma dang / mar me ma dang / dri ma dang / pi wang ma dang / gling bu ma dang / rnga zlum ma dang / rdza rnga ma dang / bzhad ma dang /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'thon pa'i me tog ma dang / bdug pa ma dang / mar me ma dang / dri ma dang / pi wang ma dang / gling bu ma dang / rnga zlum ma dang / rdza rnga ma dang / bzhad ma dang /
translated: One should offer them with the goddesses who emerge from the seed syllable in one's heart: the flower goddess, the incense goddess, the lamp goddess, the perfume goddess, the music goddess, the flute goddess, the drum goddess, the tāla goddess, and the laughter goddess.

original: sgeg ma dang / glu ma dang / gar ma dang / me long ma dang / ro ma dang / reg byam dang / chos ma rnams te lha mo bcu drug po rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgeg ma dang / glu ma dang / gar ma dang / me long ma dang / ro ma dang / reg byam dang / chos ma rnams te lha mo bcu drug po rnams kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: light, perfume, food, and music, as well as the goddesses of the sense objects of form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and phenomena.

original: de'i rjes la rkang ba brgyad pa'i sngags rnams kyis bstod de /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rkang ba brgyad pa'i sngags rnams kyis bstod de /
translated: After that, one should praise with the eight-line praises.

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa ji @375b srid btang snyoms kyi bad rnams bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa ji @375b srid btang snyoms kyi bad rnams bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having accomplished the branches of the meditation up to equanimity, such as the confession of misdeeds,

original: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dha rmm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dha rmm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
translated: one should actualize the meaning of “Oṃ. All phenomena, naturally pure.🔽My nature is naturally pure.”🔽One should view the three realms as the nature of emptiness and meditate on the three syllables, oṃ āḥ hūṃ, āḥ uṃ ha, the half-moon, and the bindu, in stages, at the end of the nāda.

original: zhes pa'i don mngon du bya zhing khams gsum pa stong pa'i rang bzhin du bltas te yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin aom a'a: h'um a'u ha mgo zla ba phyed pa thig le rnams la rim pas n'a da'i mthar bsgoms la aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra🔽sva bha ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don mngon du bya zhing khams gsum pa stong pa'i rang bzhin du bltas te yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin aom a'a: h'um a'u ha mgo zla ba phyed pa thig le rnams la rim pas n'a da'i mthar bsgoms la aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra🔽sva bha ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: zhes pa 'di'i don nang du brjod pas gsal bar bya zhing n'a da tsam gyi rnam par rtog pa yang yongs su dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'di'i don nang du brjod pas gsal bar bya zhing n'a da tsam gyi rnam par rtog pa yang yongs su dor bar bya'o //
translated: Since the meaning of this is expressed within, it is clarified and the thought of mere nada is completely abandoned.

original: sdod kyi smon lam la sogs pa'i mthus rang rang gi sa bon lhag par gnas pa'i rang gi sems n'a da'i gzugs kyis nam mkhar gzhag ste /
analyzed: sdod kyi smon lam la sogs pa'i mthus rang rang gi sa bon lhag par gnas pa'i rang gi sems n'a da'i gzugs kyis nam mkhar gzhag ste /
translated: By the power of the aspirations of the Buddha and so on, one’s mind, which is the seed of each individual, is placed in space in the form of a nada.

original: yam las skyes pa'i rlung sngon po gzhu lta bu rgyal mtshan dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yam las skyes pa'i rlung sngon po gzhu lta bu rgyal mtshan dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The blue wind, which arises from yaṃ, is like a bow with a banner.

original: ram las skyes pa'i me dmar po zur gsum du me lce bdun pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ram las skyes pa'i me dmar po zur gsum du me lce bdun pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The red fire, which arises from raṃ, is triangular with seven flames.

original: bam las skyes ba'i chu dkar po zlum po bum pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bam las skyes ba'i chu dkar po zlum po bum pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The white water, which arises from vaṃ, is round with a vase.🔽The yellow earth maṇḍala, which arises from laṃ, is square with a half-vajra in the corners.

original: lam las skyes pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po gru bzhi pa zur du rdo rje phyed pa dang bcas pa'i steng du sum las byung ba'i ri rab rin po che sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi steng du bam las skyes pa'i sna tshogs chu skyes kyi ze 'u
analyzed: lam las skyes pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po gru bzhi pa zur du rdo rje phyed pa dang bcas pa'i steng du sum las byung ba'i ri rab rin po che sna tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi steng du bam las skyes pa'i sna tshogs chu skyes kyi ze 'u
translated: On top of that, Sumeru arises from suṃ, which is the nature of various jewels.

original: 'brur gnas pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba la g-yon dang cig shas su bskor ba'i a'a li k'a li nyis 'gyur las skyes pa'i gzugs brnyan lta bu'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig la sngar gzhag pa'i n'a da las rim gyis rdzogs pa'i 'od
analyzed: 'brur gnas pa'i h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba la g-yon dang cig shas su bskor ba'i a'a li k'a li nyis 'gyur las skyes pa'i gzugs brnyan lta bu'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig la sngar gzhag pa'i n'a da las rim gyis rdzogs pa'i 'od
translated: The moon mandala, like a reflection, arises from the two sets of vowels and consonants, which are clockwise and counterclockwise around the center of a vajra cross arisen from the hūṃ located in the grain.

original: zer spro ba dang / bsdu bas lha'i 'khor lo rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin h'um yig rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zer spro ba dang / bsdu bas lha'i 'khor lo rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin h'um yig rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The light rays emanate and are reabsorbed from the nāda of the previously placed naṃ, and one should meditate on the complete form of the deity, the nature of Vajrasattva, the syllable hūṃ.

original: zla ba dang sa bon de yongs su gyur pa las dur khrod brgyad dang gzhal yas khang dang dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams dang lhan cig pa'i bcom ldan 'das g-yas brkyang ba'i zhabs gnyis kyis sna tshogs chu skye sa dang nyi ma dang 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan🔽mo rnams mnan ba /
analyzed: zla ba dang sa bon de yongs su gyur pa las dur khrod brgyad dang gzhal yas khang dang dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams dang lhan cig pa'i bcom ldan 'das g-yas brkyang ba'i zhabs gnyis kyis sna tshogs chu skye sa dang nyi ma dang 'jigs byed dang dus mtshan🔽mo rnams mnan ba /
translated: The moon and seed syllable completely transform into the Bhagavat, together with the celestial mansion, the eight charnel grounds, the maṇḍala of deities, and the two legs extended to the right, pressing down on the variegated lotus, earth, sun, Bhairava, and Kālarātri.

original: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po dang / zhal so so la spyan gsum pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po dang / zhal so so la spyan gsum pa /
translated: Each face has three eyes.

original: stag gi pags pa'i sham thams can /
analyzed: stag gi pags pa'i sham thams can /
translated: He wears a tiger-skin skirt.

original: phyag drug pa rdo rje dril bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gzung gis rdo rje rnam snang mdzad ma la 'khyud pa /
analyzed: phyag drug pa rdo rje dril bu dang bcas pa'i phyag gzung gis rdo rje rnam snang mdzad ma la 'khyud pa /
translated: He has six arms. The two that hold a vajra and a bell embrace Vajravārāhī.

original: gnyis pa'i phyag dag gis glang po che'i pags pa dkar po khrag dang bcas pa rgyab tu brgyangs nas 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i phyag dag gis glang po che'i pags pa dkar po khrag dang bcas pa rgyab tu brgyangs nas 'dzin pa /
translated: The two upper arms hold a white elephant skin with blood dripping from it, stretched out behind him.

original: gsum pa'i @376a * //
analyzed: gsum pa'i @376a * //
translated: The two lower arms

original: phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag gis da ma ru dang kha tv'am ga dang thod pa yang 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dag gis da ma ru dang kha tv'am ga dang thod pa yang 'dzin pa'o //
translated: hold a ḍamaru and a khaṭvāṅga and also hold a skull cup.

original: mi mgo rlan dang bcas pa lnga bcu'i phreng ba mgul ba la 'phyang ba /
analyzed: mi mgo rlan dang bcas pa lnga bcu'i phreng ba mgul ba la 'phyang ba /
translated: A garland of fifty fresh human heads hangs around his neck.

original: mgul rgyan dang rna rgyan dang lag gdub dang / spyi bo la 'khor lo dang / ske rags dang / mi'i rus pa'i rang bzhin gyi thal ba ste /
analyzed: mgul rgyan dang rna rgyan dang lag gdub dang / spyi bo la 'khor lo dang / ske rags dang / mi'i rus pa'i rang bzhin gyi thal ba ste /
translated: He has a necklace, earrings, bracelets, a head ornament, a belt, and human-bone ash.

original: phyag rgya drug dang / mi'i rgyus pa'i mchod phyir thogs pa dpral ba'i steng du thod pa lnga'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya drug dang / mi'i rgyus pa'i mchod phyir thogs pa dpral ba'i steng du thod pa lnga'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
translated: He has the six symbolic ornaments and a necklace of human bone marrow, and his forehead is adorned with a garland of five skulls.

original: nor bu'i g-yon phyogs su zla ba tshes pa dang / ral pa'i cod pan sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan pa /
analyzed: nor bu'i g-yon phyogs su zla ba tshes pa dang / ral pa'i cod pan sna tshogs rdo rjes mnan pa /
translated: To the left of the jewel is a crescent moon, and his topknot is pressed down by a crossed vajra.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhal cung zad bye zhing mche ba gtsigs ba sgeg pa dang / dpa' ba dang / mi sdug pa dang / drag po dang / bzhad pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba dang / snying rje dang / ngo mtshar dang / zhi ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhal cung zad bye zhing mche ba gtsigs ba sgeg pa dang / dpa' ba dang / mi sdug pa dang / drag po dang / bzhad pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba dang / snying rje dang / ngo mtshar dang / zhi ba ste /
translated: He has a slightly wrathful face with bared fangs, and he has the nine expressions of dance: charm, heroism, repulsiveness, wrath, laughter, fear, compassion, amazement, and peace.

original: gar gyi nyam dgu dang ldan par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: gar gyi nyam dgu dang ldan par bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on oneself as having these.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rnam par snang mdzad ma ni dmar mo spyan gsum ma zhal gcig ma /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rnam par snang mdzad ma ni dmar mo spyan gsum ma zhal gcig ma /
translated: The Blessed Lady Vairocanī is red, with three eyes and one face.

original: skra sil bur grol ba /🔽gcer bu thod pa'i dum bu'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
analyzed: skra sil bur grol ba / gcer bu thod pa'i dum bu'i phreng bas brgyan pa /
translated: Her hair is loose.🔽She is naked and adorned with a garland of skull pieces.

original: phyag g-yon pa thod pa yon por 'dzin pas 'khyud pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa thod pa yon por 'dzin pas 'khyud pa /
translated: She embraces with her left hand, holding an upturned skull cup.

original: zla mtshan dang ldan pas gtso bo la stobs pa /
analyzed: zla mtshan dang ldan pas gtso bo la stobs pa /
translated: She is menstruating and is in union with the principal figure.

original: g-yas sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i rdo rje steng du brkyang pas gdug pa rnams la kun du bsdigs pa /
analyzed: g-yas sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i rdo rje steng du brkyang pas gdug pa rnams la kun du bsdigs pa /
translated: With her right hand she makes a threatening gesture with a vajra extended upward, threatening the wicked.

original: khrag dang bral ba nyid kyis mi mgo skam po'i phreng ba can /
analyzed: khrag dang bral ba nyid kyis mi mgo skam po'i phreng ba can /
translated: She is without blood, wearing a garland of dry human skulls.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od can phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od can phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: She has the radiance of a solar mandala and is endowed with the five symbolic ornaments.

original: dga' ba'i spu lang dang ldan pa byin pa gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi brla gnyis la dkris te bcug pas 'khyud nas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i spu lang dang ldan pa byin pa gnyis kyis bcom ldan 'das kyi brla gnyis la dkris te bcug pas 'khyud nas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: She has the hair of passion and is embracing the Bhagavān with her two legs wrapped around his two thighs.

original: de nas phyogs kyi 'dab ma rnams la mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / khanda ro h'a dang / r'u pi n'i rnams nag mo dang / ljang gu dang / dmar mo dang / ser mo'i mdog can spyan gsum zhal gcig ma skra grol ba phyag gnyis ma g-yon pas kha tv'am ga dang thod pa /
analyzed: de nas phyogs kyi 'dab ma rnams la mkha' 'gro ma dang / l'a ma dang / khanda ro h'a dang / r'u pi n'i rnams nag mo dang / ljang gu dang / dmar mo dang / ser mo'i mdog can spyan gsum zhal gcig ma skra grol ba phyag gnyis ma g-yon pas kha tv'am ga dang thod pa /
translated: Then, on the petals in the directions, there are dakini, Lāmā, Khaṇḍarohā, and Rūpiṇī, who are black, green, red, and yellow, with three eyes, one face, loose hair, and two arms. The left hand holds a khaṭvāṅga and a skull cup.

original: g-yas pas rdo rje gri gug 'dzin pa gcer bu g-yas brkyang bas gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yas pas rdo rje gri gug 'dzin pa gcer bu g-yas brkyang bas gnas pa rnams so //
translated: They are naked, standing with right leg extended, holding a flaying knife and skull filled with blood in the left hand, and a vajra hooked knife in the right hand.

original: phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma rnams la bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i padma'i snod rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma rnams la bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i padma'i snod rnams so //
translated: On the petals in the intermediate directions are vessels filled with the five elixirs.

original: sgo rnams su khva gdong ma dang / 'ug gdong ma dang / khyi gdong ma dang / phag gdong ma rnams mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhin te zhal gzhan ming gi rjes su 'gro ba rnams so//
analyzed: sgo rnams su khva gdong ma dang / 'ug gdong ma dang / khyi gdong ma dang / phag gdong ma rnams mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa bzhin te zhal gzhan ming gi rjes su 'gro ba rnams so//
translated: At the gates are Kākāsyā, Ulūkāsyā, Śvānāsyā, and Śūkarāsyā, like the dakini and so forth, with other faces following the names.

original: @376b zur rnams su ya ma d'a dh'i dang / ya ma du tv'i dang / ya ma dam shtr'i ni dang / ya ma ma th'a n'i rnams mi'i zhal can te phyed gzugs ma'o //
analyzed: @376b zur rnams su ya ma d'a dh'i dang / ya ma du tv'i dang / ya ma dam shtr'i ni dang / ya ma ma th'a n'i rnams mi'i zhal can te phyed gzugs ma'o //
translated: In the corners are Yamadādhī, Yamaduḥkha, Yamamadamana, and Yamamathana, with human faces, half-bodied.

original: brgyad po 'di rnams ni ro'i gdan la'o //
analyzed: brgyad po 'di rnams ni ro'i gdan la'o //
translated: All eight of these are on corpse seats.

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i lha mo thams cad kyang mi mgo brgyus pa'i phreng ba mgul ban 'phyang ba /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i lha mo thams cad kyang mi mgo brgyus pa'i phreng ba mgul ban 'phyang ba /
translated: All the goddesses, such as dakini and so forth, have a garland of human heads hanging from their necks.

original: dpral ba rdo rje'i phreng bas mtshan pa /
analyzed: dpral ba rdo rje'i phreng bas mtshan pa /
translated: Their foreheads are marked with vajra garlands.

original: phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: They have the five symbolic ornaments.

original: ske rags la sgra dang bcas pa'i dril chung gi rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: ske rags la sgra dang bcas pa'i dril chung gi rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: The belt is adorned with small bells that make sounds.

original: dpral ba dang mgrin pa dang snying ga rnams su yi ge gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig sngon po ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dpral ba dang mgrin pa dang snying ga rnams su yi ge gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um yig sngon po ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'o //
translated: Bless the forehead, throat, and heart with the three syllables. In the Bhagavat's heart is a blue syllable hūṃ on a sun, the concentration being.

original: de'i thugs kar thig le n'a da dang bcas pa bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar thig le n'a da dang bcas pa bde ba chen po'i bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin bsam par bya'o //
translated: In its heart is a drop with a nada, the nature of the elixir of great bliss.

original: aom a'a:h'um aom sarba b'i ra yo gi n'i nam k'a ya b'a ka tsitta sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um aom sarba b'i ra yo gi n'i nam k'a ya b'a ka tsitta sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Om āḥ hūṃ. Om sarva vīra yoginīnāṃ kāya vāk citta svabhāva ātmako 'ham.

original: aom badzra shuddha:sarba ddharmm'a badzra shuddho& ham zhes pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra shuddha:sarba ddharmm'a badzra shuddho& ham zhes pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Om vajra śuddhaḥ sarvadharma vajra śuddho 'ham.

original: de'i rjes la aom ha /
analyzed: de'i rjes la aom ha /
translated: After that, say om haṃ.

original: na ma hi /
analyzed: na ma hi /
translated: Nama hiṃ.

original: sv'a h'a hu /
analyzed: sv'a h'a hu /
translated: Svāhā huṃ.

original: boo shat he /
analyzed: boo shat he /
translated: Vauṣaṭ he.

original: h'um h'um ho /
analyzed: h'um h'um ho /
translated: Hūṃ hūṃ ho.

original: phat ham zhes pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi ngo bos snying ga dang / spyi bo dang / spyi gtsug dang / phrag pa gnyis dang yan lag thams cad la bsrung ba bya'o //
analyzed: phat ham zhes pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi ngo bos snying ga dang / spyi bo dang / spyi gtsug dang / phrag pa gnyis dang yan lag thams cad la bsrung ba bya'o //
translated: With phat ham, one should protect the heart, the head, the crown of the head, the two shoulders, and all the limbs with the nature of the six transcendent lords.

original: aom bam ham yom hrim mom /
analyzed: aom bam ham yom hrim mom /
translated: Om bam ham yom hrim mom.

original: hrem hrim h'um h'um phat phat /
analyzed: hrem hrim h'um h'um phat phat /
translated: Hrem hrem hum hum phat phat.

original: ces pa 'dis dpa' mo drug gi snying pos lte ba dang snying ga dang / kha dang spyi gtsug dang / yan lag rnams thams cad la yang go cha bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa 'dis dpa' mo drug gi snying pos lte ba dang snying ga dang / kha dang spyi gtsug dang / yan lag rnams thams cad la yang go cha bya'o //
translated: With this, one should also armor the navel, the heart, the mouth, the crown of the head, and all the limbs with the essence mantras of the six heroines.

original: de'i rjes la rdo rje dang padma rnam par sbyangs te lha mo'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags dag gis lte ba dang / snying ga dang / rang gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dag gis mgrin pa dang dpral bar yang bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dang /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rdo rje dang padma rnam par sbyangs te lha mo'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags dag gis lte ba dang / snying ga dang / rang gi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dag gis mgrin pa dang dpral bar yang bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dang /
translated: After that, one should purify the vajra and lotus, and with the essence and close-essence mantras of the goddesses, at the navel, the heart, and with one's own essence and close-essence mantras, at the throat and the forehead, one should visualize the Bhagavat and the Bhagavatī,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dag gis mgrin pa dang dpral ba dag tu'o byas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dag gis mgrin pa dang dpral ba dag tu'o byas te /
translated: With the essence and the quintessence of the Bhagavat, one should kiss the throat and the forehead.

original: yi ge gsum gyis dga' ba brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis dga' ba brtsam par bya'o //
translated: One should begin the joy with the three syllables.

original: de nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dang 'bar ba'i phyag rgya dang / pheem yig gis kyang ye shes kyi 'khor lo bkug ste /🔽lha mo bcu drug po rnams kyis mchod @377a * //
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer dang 'bar ba'i phyag rgya dang / pheem yig gis kyang ye shes kyi 'khor lo bkug ste / lha mo bcu drug po rnams kyis mchod @377a * //
translated: Then, with the light rays of the seed syllable in one's heart and the blazing mudra and the syllable pheom, one should summon the awareness beings.🔽Having made offerings with the sixteen goddesses, one should enter one's own deities as appropriate.

original: nas ji ltar rigs par bdag nyid kyi lha rnams la rab tu bcug la aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham /
analyzed: nas ji ltar rigs par bdag nyid kyi lha rnams la rab tu bcug la aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham /
translated: One should recite Om yoga shuddha sarva dharma yoga shuddho 'ham

original: zhes brjod cing pad skor dang 'khyud pa'i stangs ka yang bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod cing pad skor dang 'khyud pa'i stangs ka yang bya'o //
translated: and perform the lotus circle and the embrace posture.

original: aom a'a:h'um zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags gsum kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags gsum kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: One should consecrate with the three mantras, Om Ah Hum, and so on.

original: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor los lhan cig byon pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang ba'i thod pa dang da ma ru 'dzin pa rnams dang / snying ga'i sa bon las spros pa'i gling bu la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams kyis //
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi 'khor los lhan cig byon pa'i rdo rje rnal 'byor ma ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang ba'i thod pa dang da ma ru 'dzin pa rnams dang / snying ga'i sa bon las spros pa'i gling bu la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams kyis //
translated: Then, the awareness-women who have come with the awareness-wheel, holding skull-cups filled with the elixir of awareness and holding ḍamarus, and the offering goddesses such as the flute-player who emanate from the seed syllable in the heart,🔽recite:

original: ji ltar bltams pa tsam nyid ni //🔽de bzhin gshegs kun khrus gsol ba //🔽lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
analyzed: ji ltar bltams pa tsam nyid ni // de bzhin gshegs kun khrus gsol ba // lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
translated: Just as he was bathed🔽by the hosts of gods immediately after birth,🔽in the same way, with this pure divine water,

original: de bzhin bdag gis khrus bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag gis khrus bgyi'o //
translated: I bathe him.

original: zhes pa brjod cing phyag g-yon pa na ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang ba'i thod pa cung zad g-yo ba 'dzin pa rnams kyis bdag la dbang bskur te bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa brjod cing phyag g-yon pa na ye shes kyi bdud rtsis gang ba'i thod pa cung zad g-yo ba 'dzin pa rnams kyis bdag la dbang bskur te bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du rnam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Saying that, and holding skull-cups filled with the elixir of awareness in the left hand, slightly shaking them, they confer empowerment on oneself, and one should meditate on the nature of great bliss.

original: chu lhag ma las grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang dang lha rnams kyi spyi bor yang ngo //
analyzed: chu lhag ma las grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang dang lha rnams kyi spyi bor yang ngo //
translated: The excess water overflows and becomes the crowning buddhas of the success family.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka sa ma ya shri ye h'um h'um phat ces pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa bhi she ka sa ma ya shri ye h'um h'um phat ces pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, Om, consecration of all Tathagatas, glory of the vow, Hum Hum Phat.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi sna tshogs rdo rjer gnas pa'i mi bskyod pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das ma'i rnam par snang mdzad de //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyi sna tshogs rdo rjer gnas pa'i mi bskyod pa'o // bcom ldan 'das ma'i rnam par snang mdzad de //
translated: Therein, Akshobhya is in the variegated vajra of the Lord,🔽Vairochana is in the Lady,

original: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rin chen dbang po'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams kyi rin chen dbang po'o //
translated: Ratnasambhava is in the dakinis, etc.,

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi don yod grub pa'o //
translated: and Amoghasiddhi is in the owl-faced ones, etc.

original: de nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las spros pa'i lha mo rnams kyi dam tshig la sogs pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo la mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las spros pa'i lha mo rnams kyi dam tshig la sogs pa rnams kyis dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi gtso bo la mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Then, having made offerings to the mandala-lord together with the mandala with the pledge-goddesses, etc., emanated from the seed in one's heart,

original: ro mar brjod pas drang zhing bdud rtsi myangs te /
analyzed: ro mar brjod pas drang zhing bdud rtsi myangs te /
translated: one should draw in with the recitation of ro ma and taste the elixir.

original: rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags rnams dang / spros pa'i lha mo rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma la bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags rnams dang / spros pa'i lha mo rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma la bstod par bya'o //
translated: One should praise the Lord and Lady with the eight-line praises and the emanated goddesses.

original: gsungs pa 'di thams cad dang khams gsum mtha' dag kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rje ro gcig pa nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i ched du rab tu zhugs te /
analyzed: gsungs pa 'di thams cad dang khams gsum mtha' dag kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rje ro gcig pa nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i ched du rab tu zhugs te /
translated: All of these statements and the entire three realms are fully engaged for the sake of fully realizing emptiness and compassion as a single taste.

original: dbugs @377b kyi 'od zer gyis yang dag par bkug pa'i 'gro ba dur khrod dang / khva gdong ma la sogs pa dang / bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma dang / bcom ldan 'das dang /
analyzed: dbugs @377b kyi 'od zer gyis yang dag par bkug pa'i 'gro ba dur khrod dang / khva gdong ma la sogs pa dang / bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ma dang / bcom ldan 'das dang /
translated: The beings who are summoned by the light rays of the breath, the charnel grounds, the dakinis of the great-bliss chakra, and so on, the Bhagavati, the Bhagavat,

original: nyi ma dang / h'um dang / a'u dang / ha dang ; mgo dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / thig le dang / n'a da rnams me long la dbugs kyi rlangs pa phog pa lta bu'i dbye ba'i rim pas 'od gsal la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang / h'um dang / a'u dang / ha dang ; mgo dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / thig le dang / n'a da rnams me long la dbugs kyi rlangs pa phog pa lta bu'i dbye ba'i rim pas 'od gsal la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: the sun, the hum, the au, the ha, the head, the half-moon, the bindu, and the nada are fully introduced to clear light by the process of differentiation, like breath on a mirror.

original: de nas skad cig la langs te /
analyzed: de nas skad cig la langs te /
translated: Then, in an instant, rise up.

original: don dam pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin lha'i 'khor lor mtha' dag kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin lha'i 'khor lor mtha' dag kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see the entire divine wheel as the nature of the non-dual ultimate reality, emptiness and compassion.

original: de nas skyon sngags bzlas par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas skyon sngags bzlas par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should recite the mantra with faults.

original: lte ba'i padma dang / zla bar n'a da dkar dmar la lha'i 'khor lo rnams dang lhan cig pa'i rlung gi 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang ldang pa rnams kyis aom a'a:h'um zhes pa nang du bzlas pa brjod pa ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa'o /

translated: The recitation of the mantra with faults is the vajra recitation, which is the recitation of the inner mantra, “oṃ āḥ hūṃ,” with the inhaling, holding, and exhaling of the wind together with the divine wheel in the white and red nāda in the moon and lotus of the navel.

original: de kho na ltar de nyid las n'a da las brjod cing lha'i tshogs spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro ba'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags rnams bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: de kho na ltar de nyid las n'a da las brjod cing lha'i tshogs spro ba dang bsdu ba sngon du 'gro ba'i snying po dang nye ba'i snying po'i sngags rnams bzla bar bya ste /
translated: Just like that, one should recite the essence and near-essence mantras, preceded by the emanation and re-absorption of the hosts of deities from the nāda in the same way.

original: lha so so re re'i sngags brjod pa yongs su rdzogs pa na so sor spro ba dang bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: lha so so re re'i sngags brjod pa yongs su rdzogs pa na so sor spro ba dang bsdu ba'o //
translated: When the recitation of the individual deity mantras is complete, one should emanate and re-absorb them individually.

original: zhes pa dam tshig gi bzlas pa goms par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dam tshig gi bzlas pa goms par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should practice the recitation of the sacred pledge.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par mos pas sngags kyi phreng ba rang gi zhal du zhugs te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par mos pas sngags kyi phreng ba rang gi zhal du zhugs te /
translated: Imagining all phenomena as the nature of equality, the mantra string enters one’s mouth.

original: rdo rje'i lam nas padmar song nas aa ba dh'u t'i'i lam nas langs te bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhal nas la thon te /🔽rang gi zhal gyi sgo nas rab tu zhugs pa de kho na ltar 'khor ba bsgom zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje'i lam nas padmar song nas aa ba dh'u t'i'i lam nas langs te bcom ldan 'das ma'i zhal nas la thon te / rang gi zhal gyi sgo nas rab tu zhugs pa de kho na ltar 'khor ba bsgom zhing /
translated: It goes through the vajra path into the lotus, and then ascends through the central channel, and emerges from the mouth of the Bhagavatī.🔽It emerges from her mouth and enters one’s own mouth.🔽Meditating in that way, one should recite the mantra string.

original: phreng ba'i sngags bzlas par bya'o zhes pa 'od li'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags bzlas par bya'o zhes pa 'od li'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: This is the recitation of light.🔽The essence mantra is:

analyzed: de la aom shr'i badzra he he ru ru kam h'um h'um phat t'a ki n'i dz'a la samba ra sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ śrī vajra he he ru ru kāra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ ākaṭi jāla sampra svāhā.🔽The essence mantra of the Bhagavat is:

analyzed: snying po'o // aom hr'i:t'a ha ha h'um h'um phat / nye ba'i snying po ste bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i ni /

analyzed: snying po'o // aom sarba buddha d'a ki n'i ye badzra barnna n'i ye h'um h'um phat /

original: nye ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i snying po'o //
translated: the essence of the essence.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang / bcom ldan 'das ma'i @378a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang / bcom ldan 'das ma'i @378a * //
translated: The mantras of the Blessed One and the Blessed Lady

original: phreng ba'i sngags gzhan du gzung bar bya'o //🔽aom t'a ki n'i ye h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags gzhan du gzung bar bya'o // aom t'a ki n'i ye h'um h'um phat /
translated: should be held as the other garlands.🔽Oṁ, Tākiniye, hūṁ hūṁ phaṭ.

original: aom l'a me h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom l'a me h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṁ, Lāmāye, hūṁ hūṁ phaṭ.

original: aom khanda ro he h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom khanda ro he h'um h'um phat /
